page.title: 06Farming
page.content: Most of the farms in the area are rented by the Drax Estate to tenant farmers. The farms are of moderate size and are mainly mixed - dairy and arable. The majority of the dairy herds are Friesian, a breed which produces a high milk yield. Milking takes place in parlours, some of which are automated. The milk is stored in refrigerated tanks and taken by bulk tanker to a reception factory at Milborne St.Andrew for distribution to cheese factories and bottling plants in the South and West of England. There is a large amount of meadow land which is used for cattle grazing. Other land is used for silage, hay and grain crops. Silage is made in early summer, followed by haymaking and the harvesting of the grain - barley, wheat, oats, etc. - in July and August.
